step1.sentence: If you plan your week on Sunday evening and prepare your materials in advance, you'll set yourself up for success before the busy days even begin.

step2.story: Maya had always struggled with her morning routine, arriving at work frazzled and unprepared. One weekend, she decided to lay out her clothes, pack her bag, and prep her meals the night before. By Monday, she walked into the office calm and confident, having set herself up for success from the start.

step3.story: Daniel had been applying for jobs for months without a single callback, and the frustration was beginning to wear him down. One evening, his mentor sat him down and pointed out that his resume was vague and his cover letters were generic. Together, they spent the weekend tailoring each application, researching companies, and practicing interview answers. Daniel sent out five carefully crafted applications the following week. Within days, two companies reached out for interviews. His mentor smiled and said, 'You finally set yourself up for success instead of just hoping for the best.' Daniel realized that preparation, not luck, had made all the difference.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 자기 자신을 성공을 위한 위치에 세워두다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 성공할 가능성을 높이기 위해 미리 조건과 환경을 갖춰두는 것을 의미한다. 단순한 노력보다는 사전 준비와 전략적 행동에 초점을 둔다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'set up'은 '준비하다, 배치하다'는 뜻이며, 여기서는 자기 자신(yourself)을 성공(success)에 유리한 상황에 놓는다는 의미로 발전했다. 스포츠나 비즈니스 맥락에서 자주 쓰이던 표현이 일상으로 확산되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적이고 주도적인 뉘앙스를 지니며, 결과보다 과정과 준비를 강조할 때 사용한다. 코치, 멘토, 자기계발 맥락에서 자주 등장하는 표현이다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Getting a good night's sleep before the exam will set yourself up for success.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 시험 전날 충분히 자는 것이 성공할 준비를 갖추는 일이다.
